quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 2 Quiz 9
quiz.subtitle: 2.9: Applications of Quadratic Functions
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Projectile Motion and Optimization via the Vertex

questions.question: A ball is thrown upward with a height modeled by $h(t) = -16t^2 + 64t + 5$. What represents the time $t$ (in seconds) at which the ball reaches its maximum height?
questions.explanation: The maximum height occurs at the vertex time $t = -b/(2a)$. Here, $t = -64 / (2 \cdot -16) = -64 / -32 = 2$.

questions.question: Using the same model $h(t) = -16t^2 + 64t + 5$, what is the actual maximum height reached by the ball?
questions.explanation: Substitute the vertex time $t=2$ into the equation: $h(2) = -16(2)^2 + 64(2) + 5 = -64 + 128 + 5 = 69$.

questions.question: A company's daily profit $P$ is modeled by $P(x) = -x^2 + 40x - 300$, where $x$ is the number of units sold. How many units must be sold to maximize profit?
questions.explanation: The maximum occurs at the vertex $x = -b/(2a)$, which is $-40 / (2 \cdot -1) = 20$.

questions.question: What is the maximum profit for the company using the model $P(x) = -x^2 + 40x - 300$?
A farmer is fencing a garden against a wall using $80$ feet of fencing for the other three sides. Area is $A(w) = -2w^2 + 80w$. What width $w$ maximizes the area?
In optimization, if a quadratic function has a positive leading coefficient ($a > 0$), what does the vertex represent?
questions.explanation: If $a > 0$, the parabola opens upward, making the vertex the lowest point (minimum) of the function.

questions.question: A projectile is launched from $10$ meters high: $h(t) = -5t^2 + 20t + 10$. When does it hit the ground ($h=0$)?
questions.explanation: Using the quadratic formula: $t = (-20 \pm \sqrt{400 - 4(-5)(10)}) / -10 = (-20 \pm \sqrt{600}) / -10 = 2 \pm \sqrt{6}$. We use the positive time value.

questions.question: A bridge arch follows $y = -0.1x^2 + 2x$. What is the horizontal distance $x$ to the highest point of the arch?
A revenue function is $R(p) = -10p^2 + 500p$. What price $p$ results in the maximum revenue?
questions.explanation: Maximum revenue occurs at the vertex price $p = -500 / (2 \cdot -10) = 25$.

questions.question: Why is the vertex the key to solving optimization problems in quadratic models?
options: It is the unique point where the function reaches its absolute extremum
It is always the y-intercept of the function
It represents where the discriminant is zero
It always represents the initial velocity
questions.explanation: In a parabola, the vertex is the specific point where the curve turns, representing the highest or lowest possible value of the output.

scoreMessages.90: Outstanding! You have a perfect grasp of how quadratics govern real-world peaks and valleys.
scoreMessages.70: Great job. Remember that $t = -b/2a$ finds the time, but you must plug it back in to find the height.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Focus on the distinction between the x-value (when) and the y-value (what) of the vertex.
scoreMessages.0: Review the vertex formula $x = -b/2a$ as it is the foundation for all optimization problems.
